facts: Delaware corporation sells products nationwide via website
California resident ordered product from website
Product was defective and caused injury
Corporation has substantial sales in California
Lawsuit filed in California state court
asp_facts: claim(c1). claim_type(c1, personal_jurisdiction). plaintiff(c1, ca_resident). defendant(c1, de_corporation). forum_state(c1, california). minimum_contacts(c1, yes). purposeful_availment(c1, yes). relatedness(c1, yes). fair_play(c1, yes). specific_jurisdiction(c1, yes).
question: Does California have personal jurisdiction over the corporation?
rationale: Specific personal jurisdiction exists because: (1) the corporation purposefully availed itself of California's market through substantial sales, (2) the claim arises from California contacts (product sold to California resident), and (3) exercising jurisdiction is fair.
